result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #16CM717.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests an adjournment due to not having notifying witnesses.  Attorney Weathers objects to request as they are ready to proceed.  Court denies adjournment request and leaves this case on for jury trial on Tuesday, March 15, 2016  (#2 jury trial).
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Filed by Atty Weathers.

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence, however Attorney Weathers now requests a jury status and jury trial.     Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-17-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weathers requests a plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets. Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 11-03-2015 02:30 pm
Hearing on September 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjournment as she was just appointed to this case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests an adjournment as he needs to see public defender because he cannot afford private counsel.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the complaint.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Ryan J Andrews in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Received copy of bond not signed by defendant
